help.p: Name by which the cited resource is known.
Free text.
Brief narrative summary of the content of the resource(s).
Free text.
Scope to which metadata applies.
dataset for spatial datasets; series for spatial dataset series; service for spatial data services.
Level of detail expressed as the scale denominator of a comparable hardcopy map or chart
Ground sample distance expressed in meters.
General explanation of the data producer’s knowledge about the lineage of a dataset.
Purpose of creating and maintaing resource (Legal, Project, Business etc...)
Seznam dalších klíčových slov - uveďte každé na nový řádek.
Reference date for the cited resource
Event type
Coordinate reference system of the resource.
Bounding box expressed as longitude/latitude in decimal format.
Time period covered by the content of the dataset.
Area of coverage reference territory by data expressed in km2.
Area of coverage reference territory by data expressed in %.
The name of territory, which coverage is tracked.
If not stated, the Territory of Czech republic is meant.
Format in which the data are stored or distributed.
Data format version. It is mandatory if data format is given.
INSPIRE Spatial data theme specification citation.
Main theme(s) of the dataset (ISO 19115 topic category)
Organisation responsible for creating, management, maintenance and distribution of the resource.
Organisation responsible for creating and maintenance of metadata. At leas one organisation role must be "Contact point"
INSPIRE data theme
Klíčová slova z thesauru GEMET. Zadejte alespoň jedno klíčové slovo. Výběr z číselníku.
Unique identifier of metadata record.
String, typically UUID.
Unique identifier of parent metadata record.
Value uniquely identifying an object within a namespace.
Value should be in form CS-[organisation-code]-[in-organisation-code], e.g. CS-CUZK-ZABAGED
access constraints applied to assure the protection of privacy or intellectual property, and any special restrictions or limitations on obtaining the resource.

help.h3: 8.1. Conditions applying to access and use
help.p: restrictions on the access and use of a resource or metadata.
Location (address) for on-line access using a Uniform Resource Locator address or similar addressing scheme.

Specify a valid URL to the resource. If no direct link to a resource is available, provide link to a contact point where more information about the resource is available. For services a link to the service capabilities document.
indication of the conformance result
Citation of the product specification or user requirement against which data is being evaluated.
Role of organisation regarding the resource.
Resource maintenance frequency.
User define Resource Maintenance expressed as ISO 8601 period.
Method used for spatial representation of resource.
Language(s) used within the datasets / series
Characters set which data are coded.
Provides information about the datasets that the service operates on.

msg.name: operatesOn_uuid
msg.label: ID
msg.help: XML Identifier of Identification element in resource metadata.

help.p: Language which is used for metadata record text elements. For multiligual metadata Main language is inteded.
A service type name from a registry of services.

help.h3: CZ-10 Spatial data service type version
help.p: Service Type version (e.g. for WMS 1.1.1, 1.3.0, for view 2.0 etc.)
Těsnost propojení služby s vázánými zdroji
Service classification according to ISO 19119

msg.name: ask-uuid
msg.label: Do you really want to change the metadata identifier? The form content will be then saved as new record!
